titleStmt.title: John P. Cook et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10521

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned petitioners respectfully represent to your Excellency that on the day of August 1861, R P, Head was fined $15.50 for a breach of the peace, in the court of H. H. Smith, Justice of the Peace for Webster Co.

They state that said Head is a poor man & has a large family to support; & tho the fine is small, it would be a hardship for him to be compelled to pay it. They further state that he is ordinarily a peacable & quiet citizen, & they think the fine in this instance exceeds the enormity of the offence committed, to such an extent as fully to justify the interposition of the Executive clemency. They therefore pray your Excellency to remit the same.

John. P. Cook
Hiram McElroy
G. W. Crew
Wm price
J. M Tompkins
I S Coffman
John W Kedrick
John F. Galbraith
B. D. Winstead
